title: China, India Try to Improve Ties Damaged by Deadly Border Clash
sub_head: Beijing’s foreign minister met with his counterpart in New Delhi, in the first high-level visit since soldiers from the two countries were killed in the Himalayas
body:
NEW DELHI—China and India took a tentative step toward repairing their damaged ties, with Beijing’s top diplomat making his first visit to New Delhi since a deadly clash along their disputed border region.
Despite the diplomatic milestone, the strained relations between the two countries were on display before and during the visit, with the efforts to ease tensions along their shared 2,000-mile border dominating three hours of discussions on Friday, said India’s foreign minister, Subrahmanyam Jaishankar.
